page.title: 05LLANBISTERS' MOTHERS UNION
page.content: Eighty years old,Llanbister's Mothers Union is an essential part of the villages' social and religious life. Membership is 20 and meetings are held every second Wednesday in the Church Hall attached to St.Cynllo's Church. Meetings open with a short service, hymn and prayers followed by a guest speaker who may also show a film. Topics usually being of a religious nature. Members in turn provide sandwiches and cakes for tea. Business follows, sometimes fund raising, a proposed outing or a special Mothers Union service. Branches within the Diocese often meet and the world wide spread of the movement is exemplified by the annual "Wave of Prayer" each branch linked; Llanbister with Mombasa, Perth and Bunbury. Thus the prayers of a few become those of a multitude.
